title: 'A bad time': Facing 211% inflation, Argentinians speak of their fatalism, resilience and hopes
summary: The deregulation of the economy and cuts in state aid introduced by far-right libertarian Javier Milei are fueling inflation across food, transport and energy, while wages struggle to keep pace.

title: Trump threatens to 'encourage' attack of NATO allies behind on payments
summary: A White House spokesman called the former president's comments at a campaign rally were 'appalling and unhinged.'

title: Côte d'Ivoire rallies to beat Nigeria 2-1 and win Africa Cup of Nations
summary: The Elephants' success on their home turf is their third title, adding to those won in 1992 and 2015.

title: Super Bowl 2024: How good is Taylor Swift’s boyfriend Travis Kelce really?
summary: The buzz around the Chiefs tight end's relationship with the pop star would almost make you forget that Kelce, who'll be playing in Sunday's Super Bowl in Las Vegas, is one of the best players at his position in NFL history.

title: Minister says France will end birthright citizenship in overseas territory Mayotte
summary: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin said there would be a constitutional reform to revoke birthright citizenship in the Indian Ocean territory, to fight a local migration crisis.

title: As Gaza war rages on, Israeli settlement expansion is accelerating in West Bank
summary: The year 2023 saw Israeli settlements expand in the occupied territory at a pace unprecedented since the signing of the Oslo Accords in 1993. Settler expansion has only accelerated since October 7.

title: Six Nations: Ireland trounces Italy 36-0
summary: The titleholders made it two wins out of two as they hosted Italy in Dublin.

title: New York Republicans focus on Jewish voters as Gaza war casts shadow
summary: The American-Israeli candidate Mazi Pilip is running to fill George Santos's House seat on Tuesday. The former Democrat has criticized those in her old party who do not support Israel.

title: UK's King Charles III attends church for first time since revealing he has cancer
summary: Charles and his wife and queen consort Camilla took part in Sunday services at St. Mary Magdalene Church in the east of England on Sunday.

title: Climate activists throw soup at Monet painting in Lyon museum
summary: Activists from a French environmentalist group called Riposte Alimentaire splashed soup onto Claude Monet's 'Le Printemps' at the Musée des Beaux-Arts.

title: Filmmaker Agnieszka Holland: 'I've always felt the Second World War wasn't really over'
summary: The Polish director, whose film Green Border was released in France this month, speaks to Le Monde about going to film school in Prague, moving to France, and the issues facing Poland today.

title: The right-wing takeover of Florida's universities
summary: Conservatives and the governor of the third most populous American state have embarked on a drive to regain control of higher education, in the name of a 'counter-revolutionary' mission designed to break the supposed hegemony of the left on campuses and 'defend the West.'

title: Our selection of 10 delicious croque-monsieur to try in Paris
summary: Whether topped with pastrami or truffled ham, made with toasted Japanese sandwich bread or a vegetarian version with comté, cheddar and morbier, this classic can be enjoyed at these 10 Parisian establishments.

title: Pro-Israeli groups are using digital guerrilla warfare against pro-Palestinian activists
summary: In France, several social media accounts have published the personal details of politicians, activists and influencers supporting Palestine across the Internet, inciting harassment. A preliminary investigation has been opened following complaints.

title: Paris 2024: An island on the Seine, a Green mayor, and 'the luck' of having the Games
summary: Mohamed Gnabaly asserts that, without the Olympic Games, he would 'never have been able to transform L'Ile-Saint-Denis,' a small town on an island wedged between two arms of the Seine that has benefited from renovations it had been waiting 15 years for.

title: Our die-hard obsession with virginity
summary: Le Monde columnist Maïa Mazaurette highlights the fixation on sexual innocence that persists in modern society.

title: Nordic artists give Israel the cold shoulder for Eurovision
summary: Many Northern European artists are calling for Israel to be banned from the competition held in Sweden. They protest against the violation of human rights in Israel's response to Hamas's attack.

title: Former PM Stubb wins Finland presidential election
summary: Stubb won 51.6% of the vote, beating former foreign minister Pekka Haavisto.

title: More than 50 people killed as Israel strikes Rafah overnight
summary: Israel's military also says it rescued two hostages from a residential building during an operation.

title: Tucker Carlson's Canadian stopover before his Moscow 'coup'
summary: American herald of the "Make America Great Again" right, Carlson's detour to Calgary offered a striking digest of the former Fox News star's rhetoric.

title: Marathon world record-holder Kelvin Kiptum has died in a car crash in Kenya
summary: Kiptum, just 24, was the first person to run a marathon under 2 hours and 1 minute.

title: France's post-Brexit financial attractiveness: a French and European challenge
summary: Hoping to amplify the momentum France has enjoyed since the UK's exit from the EU, the government is working on a financial attractiveness bill meant to defend the interests of the Paris financial center within a future European Capital Markets Union.

title: How a Chinese spy recruited a Belgian politician
summary: For at least three years, Frank Creyelman, a far-right Belgian politician, was entrusted with missions given to him by a Chinese intelligence officer. Le Monde, Der Spiegel and the Financial Times have obtained their exchanges.

title: A silent calamity: Two people die at work every day in France
summary: The underestimated figure, which does not include suicides or illnesses, illustrates a systemic problem.

title: Germany's unprecedented demonstrations against the far right could re-engage the electorate
summary: The scale of demonstrations is dividing the country's political scientists, who see it as either a flash in the pan or a real shock capable of stemming the rise of the far-right Alternative for Germany party.

title: Chiefs make stunning comeback to second straight Super Bowl title, 25-22 over 49ers in overtime
summary: It was only the second Super Bowl to go into overtime, with Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes cementing his legacy as one of the best players in history.

title: Job creations in southern Europe don't tell the whole story: 'Unemployment is dropping, because we accept miserable wages'
summary: Italy, Greece, Spain, Portugal... While unemployment has fallen sharply in these countries over the last decade thanks to the boom in tourism, the high proportion of temporary contracts as well as regional disparities persist.

title: Paris 2024: 'Like the formidable propagandist Pierre de Coubertin, the IOC has become an expert in historiographical marketing'
summary: Committed to writing its own history since the 1980s, the International Olympic Committee maintains a controversy-free presentation of Olympism.

title: AFCON 2024: Côte d'Ivoire beats the odds to claim third title in high-stakes final against Nigeria
summary: The Ivorians dominated, winning 2-1 at home against the Super Eagles on Sunday. The victory rounded off a highly competitive tournament that was something of a 'miracle' for the host nation.

title: Some simple ideas for peace in the Middle East
summary: The ongoing catastrophe in Gaza risks ushering in a new cycle of even more atrocious wars unless the Israeli-Palestinian conflict is resolved once and for all as part of a two-state solution.

title: Hospitalized Pentagon chief Lloyd Austin hands duties to deputy
summary: Austin, 70, had kept previous hospital stays secret and had not immediately informed US President Joe Biden of his cancer diagnosis.

title: France's move to end birthright citizenship in overseas Mayotte looks to answer local anger
summary: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin promised a constitutional reform to make an exception to birthright citizenship in the Indian Ocean territory. The population has been protesting against a wave of illegal immigration.

title: Court orders Netherlands to stop delivery of F-35 parts to Israel
summary: The US-owned fighter jets parts are stored at a warehouse in the Netherlands and then shipped to several partners, including Israel.

title: Trump alarms allies by questioning NATO's solidarity
summary: The former American president said he was ready to 'encourage' Russian authorities 'to do whatever the hell they want' to any NATO country that did not contribute enough to the alliance's budget.

title: How 6-year-old Hind Rajab was killed as Palestinian Red Crescent tried to rescue her
summary: The child's cry for help had been widely broadcast as she was trapped under Israeli fire. The Red Crescent accused Israel of 'deliberately' targeting the ambulance sent to rescue her.

title: Finland elects pro-NATO Alexander Stubb as president
summary: Both a Europhile and NATO fan, the 55-year-old former prime minister and foreign minister is in favor of a 'more European' NATO.

title: Israeli army now pounds Rafah, Gaza's last refuge
summary: In this heavily shelled Palestinian city, which has become home to over 1 million displaced persons, Israeli security services announced the release of two hostages kidnapped by Hamas.

title: The 'SAHG,' the girlfriend who patiently waits for her man to come home
summary: Anne Chirol reports on the digital archetypes of our time, from the #tradwife to the #fuckboy. This week, she focuses on the 'Stay at Home Girlfriend,' that homebody who doesn't work and is both emotionally and financially dependent.

title: French men are increasingly turning to vasectomy
summary: The number of men opting for this form of contraception has risen from 1,940 in 2010 to 30,288 in 2022, thus overtaking female sterilizations, according to a study.

title: In Côte d'Ivoire, many men don't attend their child's birth
summary: Many dads put forward practical, cultural, historical or sexist reasons for not being there, but this custom is only slowly changing.

title: What kind of work will be desirable in 2050?
summary: While it's easier to see what new technologies will destroy rather than what they will create, researchers are still trying to anticipate what work will be like in the future, writes Le Monde columnist Anne Rodier.

title: Rwanda plan incompatible with UK's rights obligations, British lawmakers warn
summary: The British Parliament's Joint Committee on Human Rights said in a new report that it had various concerns regarding the so-called Safety of Rwanda Bill.

title: The French far-right supporters who'd like to see Le Pen's lieutenant run instead of her
summary: Many members of the Rassemblement National party consider the young Jordan Bardella to be in a better position to win the next presidential election.

title: France uncovers vast network of Russian disinformation sites
summary: One hundred and ninety-three fake news websites targeting both Ukraine and European countries, including France, Germany and Poland, have been identified. However, their audience seems limited.

title: Ukraine calls for Poland to 'punish' grain-spilling farmers as probe opened
summary: Polish farmers forcibly pried open Ukrainian trucks crossing into the European Union amid protests against what they see as cheap imports.

title: How far can Marine Le Pen's deputy, Jordan Bardella, go?
summary: The 28-year-old chair of the far-right Rassemblement National party has become a household name in French politics. He is more popular than his mentor Marine Le Pen, and some wonder: Would he dare turn against her?

title: Victims of London's Grenfell Tower disaster express their grief and anger
summary: Nearly seven years after the fire that claimed 72 lives, survivors and relatives of the deceased shared their stories. While a criminal trial has yet to take place, their testimonies were an attempt to confront those responsible with the terrible consequences of their negligence.

title: France suspends subsidized electric car program after surge
summary: The French government said it was suspending the plan to lease electric cars from €100 a month after subsidizing more than double the number of vehicles planned for 2024.
